snippet: A new class of sanitation workers learns how to drive garbage trucks and grapple with snow chains, and why trash bags are best held at arm’s length.
abstract: New York City's Sanitation Department academy will train 450 new workers before the start of the snow season, bringing its force to 6,000 uniformed workers; unglamorous job requires significant training, including drills on how to properly operate garbage trucks that are conducted at Floyd Bennett Field in Brooklyn.
lead_paragraph: A new class of sanitation workers learns how to drive garbage trucks and grapple with snow chains, and why trash bags are best held at arm’s length.

headline.main: At This Academy, the Curriculum Is Garbage
headline.print_headline: At This Academy, the Curriculum Is Garbage
